Term.Name: 3.5 inch diskette digital data disk reel
Term.Definition: A random access, removable data storage medium that can be used with personal computers. This is a magnetic medium housed in a rigid plastic cartridge measuring 35 inches square and about 3 millimetres thick Also called a 35-inch diskette, it can store up to 144 megabytes (MB) of data
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML. First version date is version date from reference publisher

Term.Name: 5.25 inch diskette digital data disk reel

Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML. First version date is version date from reference publisher

Term.Name: 8 inch diskette digital data disk

Term.Name: DVD (Digital Versatile Disk) digital television disk Single sided, single layer, 12 cm dia.
Term.Definition: Digital versatile disk: A high density development of the compact disk It is the same size as a CD but stores from 4.38 GB (seven times CD capacity) on a single sided, single layer disk DVDs can also be double sided or dual layer-storing even more data This is 4.7 GB , 1 side, 1 layer
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML. First version date is version date from reference publisher

Term.Name: DVD (Digital Versatile Disk) digital television disk Single sided, double layer, 12 cm dia.
Term.Definition: Digital versatile disk: A high density development of the compact disk It is the same size as a CD but stores from 4.38 GB (seven times CD capacity) on a single sided, single layer disk DVDs can also be double sided or dual layer-storing even more data This is 8.5 GB , 1 side, 2 layers
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML. First version date is version date from reference publisher
